question.questionA: Capitula unisexual, the male with several  florets, the female with one to two florets.
question.questionB: Capitula with all florets hermaphrodite, or with outer florets male, female or sterile; capitula rarely all female and then florets numerous.

question.questionA: Involucral bracts of female capitula fused together.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts of female capitula free.

question.questionA: Stems spiny.
question.questionB: Stems without spines.

question.questionA: Ligulate florets absent.
question.questionB: Ligulate florets present.

question.questionA: Ray-florets without a corolla, or corolla abortive.
question.questionB: Ray-florets with a tubular corolla.

question.questionA: Wooly  annuals;  stems  procumbent,  rooting at the nodes; leaves pinnatisect;  capitula  solitary,  apparently  sessile;  disc-florets whitish;  ray-florets without a corolla.
question.questionB: Glabrous  annuals  or  perennials;  leaves  deeply  divided  into  oblong dentate lobes, strongly aromatic, base white and sheathing; capitula solitary, on a prominent scape; disc-florets with white corolla tube, topped with four yellow lobes; ray-florets without a corolla or corolla abortive.

question.questionA: Leaves not spiny.
question.questionB: Leaves spiny.

question.questionA: Pappus absent, or achene with a short crown or ear-like projection.
question.questionB: Pappus of scales or hairs, at least on the inner achenes.

question.questionA: Capitula pink, purple or violet.
question.questionB: Capitula yellow, white or brownish.

question.questionA: Involucral bracts spiny.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts not spiny.

question.questionA: Involucral  bracts scarious, pale brownish yellow, dark at the tip with a simple reflexed spine.
question.questionB: Involucral  bracts green with scarious appendages, spines not reflexed or absent.

question.questionA: Spiny appendages more than twice the length of the involucral bracts.
question.questionB: Spiny appendages shorter than the involucral bracts.

question.questionA: Capitula yellow.
question.questionB: Capitula purple.

question.questionA: Leaves green; involucral bracts without an appendage, surmounted by three short spines.
question.questionB: Leaves  glaucous;  involucral   bracts  with  a  decurrent  fimbriate appendage ending in a single spine.

question.questionA: Capitula  solitary,  3  cm  across;  involucre  of  numerous  overlapping bracts, resembling a pine cone; involucral bracts with an oval scarious brownish appendage.
question.questionB: Capitula less than 3 cm across; involucre not resembling a pine cone.

question.questionA: Capitula 2 cm across; florets reddish purple; involucral bracts green with a prominent scarious margin, fringed at the top.
question.questionB: Capitula less than 1 cm across.

question.questionA: Leaves entire.
question.questionB: Leaves pinnatifid.

question.questionA: Stems erect, elongate not forming rosettes; capitula axillary and terminal;  inner  involucral  bracts  saccate, each enclosing a marginal floret.
question.questionB: Stems compressed, forming rosettes; capitula solitary or in terminal clusters.

question.questionA: Margins of rosette leaves entire.
question.questionB: Margins of rosette leaves revolute with a pale acuminate tip.

question.questionA: Capitula solitary; shrubs; leaves greyish, wooly-haired.
question.questionB: Capitula in branched pyramidal clusters.

question.questionA: Leaves whitish; capitula yellowish, globular 5-6 mm across.
question.questionB: Leaves greyish green; capitula orange, ovoid 1-2 mm across.

question.questionA: Cauline leaves opposite; capitula pink or lilac, in a flat-topped cluster; pappus of simple hairs.
question.questionB: Cauline leaves alternate, or stems with scale leaves only.

question.questionA: Plants  viscid;  capitula  few-flowered;  inner  involucral bracts linear, scarious apart from the green midrib, ciliate; outer involucral bracts lanceolate, green, glandular-hairy; inner bracts twice the length of the outer.
question.questionB: Plants not viscid; capitula many-flowered or, if few-flowered, then involucral bracts not as above.

question.questionA: Pappus of scales or simple hairs.
question.questionB: Pappus with at least some hairs branched and plumose.

question.questionA: Capitula yellow, whitish green or brownish.
question.questionB: Capitula pink, purple or bluish.

question.questionA: Capitula usually less than 5 mm long.
question.questionB: Capitula usually more than 5 mm long.

question.questionA: Outer involucral bracts scarious, shining, bright yellow.
question.questionB: Outer involucral bracts with a scarious margin.

question.questionA: Leaves usually less than 25 mm long.
question.questionB: Leaves usually more than 30 mm long.

question.questionA: Inner involucral bracts oblong, with minute reddish glands, five to eight times as long as the outer oval bracts.
question.questionB: Inner involucral  bracts spathulate, eglandular, twice as long as the outer oval bracts.

question.questionA: Leaves up to 25 mm long; capitula in spreading clusters, ovoid.
question.questionB: Leaves up to 10 mm long; capitula in compact clusters, globular.

question.questionA: Leaves less than 7 mm wide; branches of the inflorescence without scarious bracts.
question.questionB: Lower  leaves more  than 7 mm wide; scarious bracts at branching points on the inflorescence.

question.questionA: Receptacle  without  scales;  involucre rounded in section, bracts spreading at maturity.
question.questionB: Receptacle with scales among the marginal  florets; involucre angular in section, bracts not spreading at maturity.

question.questionA: Leaves linear; capitula in clusters of two to six, markedly exceeded by the leaves.
question.questionB: Leaves ovate or lanceolate; capitula in clusters of eight to forty, not exceeded by the leaves.

question.questionA: Leaves ovate; capitula in clusters of twenty to forty, not over-topped by the subtending leaves.
question.questionB: Leaves spathulate; capitula in clusters of eight to twenty, over-topped by the subtending leaves.

question.questionA: Involucral bracts scarious; capitula solitary or few.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts green; capitula numerous in a branched cluster.

question.questionA: Scape branched; capitula in clusters of one to three.
question.questionB: Scape unbranched; capitula solitary.

question.questionA: Margins of middle involucral bracts undulate.
question.questionB: Margins of middle involucral bracts flat.

question.questionA: Involucral bracts of many unequal rows.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts of one row and a few much smaller outer bracts.

question.questionA: Involucral bracts spiny-pointed and hooked.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts not hooked.

question.questionA: Involucral   bracts  with  a  scarious margin  or  appendage;  or  with  a branched spine; or a simple caducous spine.
question.questionB: Involucral  bracts without spines, scarious margins or appendages; or with a simple persistent spine.

question.questionA: Pappus dark purplish.
question.questionB: Pappus whitish.

question.questionA: Shrubby, woody based perennials.
question.questionB: Herbaceous plants; leaves bristly haired; pappus fused in a ring at the base of the achene.

question.questionA: Stem leafy to close  beneath the capitula, with continuous broad spinous wings; inner bracts equalling or exceeding the florets.
question.questionB: Stem naked beneath  the  capitula, with  interrupted narrow spinous wings; inner bracts falling short of the florets.

question.questionA: Involucral bracts with an appendage or a broad scarious margin.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts without an appendage or a scarious margin.

question.questionA: Receptacle fleshy; achenes quadrangular in section; capitula usually 5 cm or more across.
question.questionB: Receptacle not fleshy; achenes laterally compressed; capitula usually 4 cm or less across.

question.questionA: Uppermost leaves greatly exceeding and obscuring the capitula.
question.questionB: Uppermost leaves not obscuring the capitula.

question.questionA: Capitula 4-5 cm across; involucral bracts prolonged into in a robust yellow spine; leaves spiny.
question.questionB: Capitula 8-15 cm across; involucral bracts blunt, spineless; leaves spineless.

question.questionA: Biennials to 100 cm and above; florets bluish purple, over-topped by the upper cauline leaves.
question.questionB: Perennials to 50 cm; florets reddish or whitish purple, not over-topped by the upper cauline leaves.

question.questionA: Perennials with long tap-roots; flowering stems winged; leaves roughly hairy and prickly on the upper surface, dull;  capitula  reddish  purple, 30-50 mm across.
question.questionB: Rhizomatous  perennials with numerous adventitious flowering and non-flowering shoots; flowering stems wingless; leaves not prickly on the upper surface, sometimes hairy, often glossy; capitula pale purple or white, 15-25 mm across.

question.questionA: Leaves with short marginal  spines, green white-veined above, white-tomentose  below;  capitula  sol itary,  scapes  long  slender  straight; involucral  bracts entirely scarious, linear-lanceolate, imbricate; florets lilac.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts not both entirely scarious and linear-lanceolate.

question.questionA: Pappus absent, or pappus of scales or simple hairs.
question.questionB: Pappus of branched or plumose hairs on at least some fruits.

question.questionA: All   involucral   bracts scarious, inner bracts exceeding the  florets;  pappus of bristles.
question.questionB: At least the outer involucral bracts green.

question.questionA: Receptacle without scales or bristles, pitted.
question.questionB: Receptacle with scales or bristles.

question.questionA: Involucral   bracts  spiny-toothed  or with a terminal  pinnate spine; pappus in one row or absent.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts entire acute, or with a simple spine.

question.questionA: Capitula yellow.
question.questionB: Capitula white or purple.

question.questionA: Perennials up to 20 cm, or stemless; leaves glabrous, apart from rachis, pinnatisect;  inner  involucral   bracts  green, with an ovate fringed appendage; disc-florets purple.
question.questionB: Perennials  up  to  60  cm;  leaves  wooly-haired,  lanceolate; inner involucral  bracts scarious, with a rounded fringed appendage; disc-florets white.

question.questionA: Filaments of the stamens fused at the base to form a tube; leaves variegated white and green.
question.questionB: Filaments of the stamens not fused at the base to form a tube; leaves green.

question.questionA: Inner  involucral  bracts,  long, brightly coloured or white, spreading outwards.
question.questionB: Inner involucral bracts not spreading outwards.

question.questionA: Capitula in flat-topped clusters; upper surface of inner involucral  bracts bright golden yellow; leaves almost glabrous.
question.questionB: Capitula usually solitary;  upper  surface  of inner involucral  bracts purple; leaves wooly-haired.

question.questionA: Achenes hairy.
question.questionB: Achenes glabrous.

question.questionA: Pappus hairs of inner achenes plumose, of outer achenes simple.
question.questionB: Pappus hairs of all achenes plumose.

question.questionA: Filaments of stamens fused into a tube.
question.questionB: Filaments of stamens free.

question.questionA: Receptacle  fleshy;  capitula usually 5  cm or more  across;  involucral bracts broad.
question.questionB: Receptacle not fleshy; capitula usually less than 5 cm across; involucral bracts narrow.

question.questionA: Pappus of scales or hairs.
question.questionB: Pappus absent, or achene with a crown or ear-like projection.

question.questionA: Pappus of scales.
question.questionB: Pappus of hairs.

question.questionA: Ligules yellow above (pale yellow towards the tip), greenish purple below,  lanceolate,  tips  acute;  leaves green  above, white-tomentose below; achenes wooly-haired.
question.questionB: Ligules yellow, oblong, tips blunt, dentate; leaves green, hairy; achenes not wooly-haired.

question.questionA: Annuals, erect, dichotomously branched; outer involucral  bracts  linear-lanceolate, greatly exceeding the ligules of the ray florets.
question.questionB: Perennials,  tufted, woody based; outer  involucral  bracts  spathulate, equalling the ligules of the ray florets.

question.questionA: Ray florets white, bluish or violet.
question.questionB: Ray florets yellow.

question.questionA: Ligules very narrow, in several rows.
question.questionB: Ligules not very narrow, usually in a single row.

question.questionA: Capitula solitary; ligules conspicuous spreading
question.questionB: Capitula in elongated panicles; ligules tiny erect.

question.questionA: Plants slightly hairy; ligules just exceeding pappus.
question.questionB: Plants distinctly hairy; ligules shorter than pappus.

question.questionA: Annuals or biennials;  leaves not  fleshy;  capitula numerous,  in highly branched terminal pyramidal clusters.
question.questionB: Perennials; leaves fleshy; capitula axillary, solitary or in pairs.

question.questionA: Pappus  two-rowed,  the outer of  short-toothed scales, the inner of hairs.
question.questionB: Pappus solely of hairs.

question.questionA: Annuals; ray-florets white or pale lilac, little longer than the disc-florets.
question.questionB: Perennials; ray florets yellow markedly longer than the disc-florets.

question.questionA: Upper  leaves  lanceolate-elliptical, margins undulate;  capitula greatly exceeded by adjacent subtending leaves; ray florets white.
question.questionB: Upper  leaves  linear-lanceolate,  entire;  capitula  without  adjacent subtending leaves; ray florets pale lilac.

question.questionA: Stems and leaves not white-tomentose; capitula solitary.
question.questionB: Stems and leaves white-tomentose; capitula in dense clusters.

question.questionA: Perennials,  spreading; leaves lanceolate or pinnatifid, green above, white tomentose below; scapes rigid, erect; ligules up to 4 cm long, deep orange with a black spot at the base.
question.questionB: Ligules up to 1 cm, yellow or lilac.

question.questionA: Involucral  bracts of equal  length, in one to three ranks, not overlapping, often with small bracts at the base.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts unequal, in several overlapping ranks.

question.questionA: Capitula 5-10 mm across, usually in racemes or racemose panicles.
question.questionB: Capitula 10 mm or more across, usually solitary or in cymose panicles or corymbs.

question.questionA: Plants  viscid, with glandular hairs, strongly aromatic; achenes not ribbed, narrowed into a neck and then expanding into a cupule which supports the pappus.
question.questionB: Plants not viscid, eglandular; achenes ribbed, without neck or cupule.

question.questionA: Perennials; leaves amplexicaul; ray-florets markedly longer than disc- florets.
question.questionB: Annuals; leaves not amplexicaul; ray florets scarcely exceeding disc- florets.

question.questionA: Perennial herbs; ligules absent (see 38 above) or very small.
question.questionB: Fleshy  shrubs;  ray  florets markedly  longer  than disc-florets, ligules prominent.

question.questionA: Ligulate florets absent
question.questionB: Ligulate florets present.

question.questionA: Shrubby  perennials,  densely  white-tomentose; leaves bipinnatifid; capitula in dense flat-topped clusters.
question.questionB: Herbaceous  plants,  not  densely  white-tomentose; leaves simple, dentate; capitula solitary or in pairs.

question.questionA: Capitula lilac; leaves glaucous.
question.questionB: Capitula yellow; leaves shiny dark green above, purplish below.

question.questionA: Ray-florets white, whitish-yellow, pink or purple.
question.questionB: Ray-florets yellow.

question.questionA: All leaves radical; scapes leafless.
question.questionB: Scapes leafy.

question.questionA: Involucral bracts in one row.
question.questionB: Involucral bracts in two rows.

question.questionA: Receptacle without scales.
question.questionB: Receptacle with scales.

question.questionA: Achenes laterally compressed, smooth; small annuals.
question.questionB: Achenes ribbed; perennials.

question.questionA: Annuals; cauline leaves present.
question.questionB: Perennials; all leaves radical

question.questionA: Achenes quadrangular, ribbed.
question.questionB: Achenes laterally compressed, not ribbed.

question.questionA: Perennials;  leaves  fleshy;  involucral   bracts  green  with  a  prominent scarious appendage.
question.questionB: Annuals or biennials; leaves not fleshy; involucral  bracts more or less scarious, appendages small or absent.

question.questionA: Aromatic  annuals  or  biennials;  receptacular scales, lanceolate, mucronate,  dispersed  over  the  whole  receptacle;  involucral   bracts oblong, pale, tipped with small scarious appendages, downy, with adpressed hairs; ray-florets female; achenes ribbed, not tuberculate.
question.questionB: Foetid annuals; receptacular scales linear, restricted to the top of the conical receptacle; involucral bracts oblong, blunt, with a green midrib and broad scarious margins, more or less glabrous; ray-florets sterile, without styles; achenes ribbed and tuberculate.

question.questionA: Corolla tube in disc-florets saccate.
question.questionB: Corolla tube in disc-florets not saccate.

question.questionA: Receptacle with scales; involucre spiny; leaves entire.
question.questionB: Receptacle without scales.

question.questionA: Achenes strongly incurved, with swellings on the back; leaves simple, remotely dentate.
question.questionB: Fruit straight or slightly curved; leaves serrate or pinnatifid.

question.questionA: Leaves bipinnate or tripinnate, segments lanceolate, acute, entire or dentate; ligules pale yellow or white with a yellow base.
question.questionB: Leaves slightly fleshy, simple, irregularly serrate; ligules bright yellow.
